name: Push Press
how_to_perform:
1. Hold a weight or barbell at shoulder height with your hands shoulder-width apart.

2. Take a slight step forward with the foot opposite to your working arm, keeping your front heel planted firmly on the ground.

3. Bend your knees slightly and lean back to activate your core muscles.

4. Now, lower the weight down towards your shoulders, keeping it close to your body.

5. Then, explosively drive upward through your heels to push the weight straight up from your shoulders, extending your arms fully.

6. At the top of the movement, press the weight straight up and forward, squeezing your shoulder muscles as you lift.

7. Return the weight down to your shoulders by reversing the motion, keeping control throughout the exercise.
short_summary: A push press is an upper-body strength training exercise that focuses on building explosive power in the shoulders.
